name: Basic Survival
description: First up, setting up the very basics of survival. Food, shelter, water. Especially water.

quests.name: Desperate Times...
quests.description: You may have noticed the lack of food on this planet. Well, I have a temporary solution. You aren't going to like it much, but given the only alternative is starving to death...

tasks.longDescription: You see all that dust around you? Well, I am reading high concentrations of salt. I'm positive you can get useful amounts just by doing a little sifting. Sticking a salt water bottle in a furnace would also work, although it ruins the bottle.
This place seems to be infested by can only be called zombies. Go grab a few bits of rotten flesh from them for the next task.
Ok, combine 1 rotten flesh with 2 salt and you have something that is edible. Barely. Well, it will keep you alive long enough to find something better at least.

quests.name: Hunger Games
quests.description: Well, things are looking a little less desperate. Maybe. Still, without a stable food supply you won't last long. You an use a watering can to help grow crops.

tasks.longDescription: Rice seeds can be sifted from dirt and grown with bonemeal. Remember, you CANNOT till dirt into farmland if there is no water nearby.

If you want more cariety in your crops than what sifting dirt can provide, you will need some grass. Right clicking a grass block with a mattock when you are more than 4 blocks away from water will give you seeds. It will also turn the grass back into dirt. Be careful to leave at least one grass block to allow the rest to regrow over time.

quests.name: Firing it up
quests.description: As hot as it is here, it isn't nearly hot enough to cook food. For that, you will need a furnace. Sieve dirt for stones, use the stones to make cobblestone, from that comes a slab furnace

tasks.longDescription: Six cobblestone is all you need.

quests.name: Drinking Mud
quests.description: Water is scarce. In a pinch you can get water from dirt. One bottle and one dirt and there you go. It isn't very healthy, but if you don't have a choice...

quests.name: Stocking Eyes
quests.description: Ok, zombie jerky is bad, I know. Still, you're alive and that is what counts, right? Well, I have another recipe for you. I'm afraid it isn't much better though.

tasks.longDescription: You take 1 bone, gotten from those nasty bow weilding skeletons, combine that with a pot and a mixing bowl and you end up with 3 stock. Good as an emergency food but it also is an ingredient as well.
Ok, you have your stock. If you want to make it more nourishing, if not more appealing, drop it into a pot with a spider eye. Disgusting, yes but it will keep you fed.

quests.name: Log Entry
quests.description: Here we go again, another star system. Might be a little different this time, though. One of the planets appears to have a breathable atmosphere, although we aren't picking up any water or anything organic. Captain says we will have to land the shuttle to take a closer look. I might see if I can get on that mission. It has to be more exciting than staring at display screens all day. Then again, spending several hours on a hot, dry, lifeless dustball of planet doesn't sound much better.

quests.name: The End of the Beginning
quests.description: Well, you have done it. You now have a stable supply of both food and water. You have tools to shape the land around you and weapons and armor with which to defend yourself from attack. It is time to start looking beyond your immediate survival and start planning for the future.

tasks.longDescription: Remember, plastic sheets can be made from either raw plastic or the plastic from Pneumaticcraft.

quests.name: Sapping the Saplings
quests.description: I have found a way to get water. If you drop saplings in the Liquid Transposer you will get a little bit of water out of them, 1/10th a bucket. Remember, you can power the Transposers with the flux capacitors in your emergency supply chest. MAKE SURE YOU DO NOT USE UP ALL YOUR SAPLINGS!

tasks.longDescription: You MUST use the QDS to hand in this task. Click select task, place the QDS, and right click it with the quest book. Placing the QDS next to a Transposer with the output set to the approriate side will work.

quests.name: Purified
quests.description: Dirty water is useful in a pinch, but for long term survival you need a way to purify it. Fire will work nicely. Drop the dirty water bottle into a furnace, apply heat, get clean water. Science!

quests.name: Log Entry
quests.description: Crap. I think I'm the only one left. I finally got my excitement and adventure and I don't want it. Also, I take back every negative thing I said about that hazard suit. It just saved my life thanks to it being a closed air system. The Wanderlust had just settled into orbit of the planet and I was stuck in engineering cleaning the reactor crawlways. Again. Just as I was about to wrap up there was a terrific bang and I was flung hard into a bulkhead. I was knocked out and when I came to my hazard suit showed that I was in hard vacuum. I made my way to out of the crawlways and the engineering display boards. Ship diagnostics show a major hull breach somewhere around the bridge which has led to complete venting of the ships atmosphere. Outside of me, I see no life signs anywhere on board. Fifty crew, dead in minutes. Damn. Now I have to figure out what to do so I don't join them.

quests.name: Making a Killing!
quests.description: Wow, impressive job clearing some of the monsters away from the shuttle.

tasks.longDescription: No matter how many you kill, there always seems to be more.
Be careful with the SPAMR

quests.name: Power Underwhelming
quests.description: Well, we are finally getting somewhere. However, before we can really progress we need a source of power. I think I've found the perfect place to start. Those teleporting aliens leave behind these curious pearls that give off some strange energy. I think you could build a generator that uses those as fuel.

tasks.longDescription: At a bit over 20 minutes per ender pearl this isn't a bad source of power. I'm sure we can do better, however.

quests.name: Cooking Utensils
quests.description: Right, this is simple. If you don't want to be stuck eating bits of monsters and wriggling things off of trees you must make some kitchen utensils.

tasks.longDescription: Be creative when trying to decide what to eat. Take some time looking up the uses for your raw ingredients, there are surpising amounts of different foods to choose from.

quests.name: Log Entry
quests.description: When I signed up with the DSS Wanderlust for a 2 year tour exploring unknown space I expected things to be like those old sci-fi shows. Weird planets, strange space anomolies, bizarre aliens, adventure and excitement every day. As it turns out, space exploration is boring. We speed weeks in long jump space going from star to star, which is boring. Then once in a new solar system we spend a month going from planet to planet taking readings and making scans. Which means staring at display screens for hours on end. Tedious as well as boring. Oh, and since I'm the only Ensign on this ship. and therefore the lowest ranked officer, I get stuck doing all the crap jobs no one else wants. I've spent more time in a cramped, awkward, hot, smelly hazard suit doing maintenance in the reactor room than any one person should ever be expected to.

quests.name: Melting Leaves!?
quests.description: Oddly enough, if you toss leaves into a crucible they will melt down into a little bit of water. No, I'm not sure how that works, either. You don't get much, but it makes investing in shears early a good idea.

quests.name: Night Fright
quests.description: Ok, there is something seriously wrong with this planet. Are those really skeletons and zombies? And what is up with those exploding green things? Did that tall black monstronsity TELEPORT?! This is bad. Really, REALLY bad. Still, perhaps we can make use of what they leave behind when killed....

quests.name: Metal Dust
quests.description: What it lacks in water this place makes up for in metals. We can start getting some serious infrastructure going if you just spend a little time sifting the dust all around.

quests.name: Iceberg
quests.description: Ok, you now have snow. Quick, before it melts use it to build a Glacial Precipitator!

tasks.longDescription: A snowball and a water bottle will give you cold water. Useful if you get overheated.

quests.name: The Hard Route
quests.description: Choose this path if you want a challenge. Expect to die. A lot. Note: Choosing this path will disable the Easy Route quest.

tasks.longDescription: If you want an even harder challenge, enable Zombie Awareness. Be aware, however, that it sometimes causes lag. Have fun and try not to die repeatedly!

quests.name: What Has Gone Before
quests.description: If you don't care about the backstory you can ignore this quest safely. (Note: There is no actual item to pick up, just go to the location noted and return)

tasks.longDescription: You lost your DataTablet in the crash. It contains, among other things, all your personal logs. However, you see something glinting in the sun near the shuttle. Check it out.
You managed to rescue your DataTablet from the dust. It is pretty banged up, though. Take it back to the shuttle and see what you can pull off of it.

quests.name: The Very Basics
quests.description: As part of my functions, I can replicate needed items if provided with the raw materials. My capacity is limited at this point, so I can't provide much. Sift some of the dust to get  bonemeal. With that, 1 dust, and a bottle of water I can provide you an essential survival material.

tasks.longDescription: Make sure you plant something in the dirt right away!

quests.name: Blending Ores
quests.description: Until you get a smeltery going, which could take a while, you need some way to make invar blend. If you don't mind a bit of manual labor, there is a solution readily available.

tasks.longDescription: Simply place the ingots you wish to grind in the grind stone, and insert the crank. A few right clicks will soon pulverize the ingots. As a note, when the crank stops and refuses to turn, the process is done. Continuing to right click at this point may break the crank. Also, this process may not be automated.

So, what do you do with pulverized metal? You mix it together with other metals to make blends. 2 iron and a nickel (only available by sifting gravel and sand) make invar, a gold and a silver make electrum, 3 copper and a tin make Tinker's alloy, also known as bronze.

These blends have many uses. Invar is useful for tools, including shears that have increased durability over the iron variant, weapons, and armor. It is also a central component in many Thermal Expansion recipes, including simple upgrades to portable tanks, leadstone energy cells, flux capacitors, and leadstone energy conduits. Bronze is key to a few Thermal Expansion recipes as well, as well as making decent Tinker's Construct weapons and tools. Electrum will be useful later as you progress technologically.

quests.name: Gathering Supplies
quests.description: Well, that is a mess. Grab what you can from the wreck, and watch out for that detached engine. The core has been breached and the fuel is leaking

tasks.longDescription: Tasks of this type do not have to be handed in, having them in one's inventory is enough. However, you MUST have all the items at once. Also, that camel pack goes on your chest. Camel packs are filled with water bottles in a crafting grid. You can use a empty bottle to empty one, if you wish

quests.name: Even More Desperate
quests.description: Well, zombie jerky on its own probably isn't enough. If you are in dire enough straits almost anything looks edible.

tasks.longDescription: Don't forget you can craft a frying pan out of bones. Don't ask me how that works. The silk worms come from hitting leaves with a crook. Right click the ground with your frying pan and drop in the worms and fuel of some sort.

quests.name: Even Hotter
quests.description: With a furnace up, you can now take your next step. Look by the port engine, the one not currently on fire. Apparently the water reclamation leaked a little and has turned some of the dust to clay. Dig it up and make a crucible. Stick a torch under that and not only can you melt cobble to lava but you can smelt ore dust to ingots, if you provide it with a faucet and a casting table or basin.

tasks.longDescription: You can use the crucible like a mini-smeltery. Shift-right click to place a faucet. It only takes blocks, not dusts or broken pieces of ore. If you've saved the pyrotheum by the broken engine, you can use that to heat your crucible. Also, you can make casts by pouring gold over stone parts.

quests.name: The Easy Route
quests.description: For a kinder, gentler experience, this is the way to go. Note: Choosing this path disables the Hard Route quest.

tasks.longDescription: If you want an even easier experience, disable the Special Mobs mod. Have fun and try not to get too discouraged if you die a few times at first!

quests.name: Getting Chilly
quests.description: You may have noticed it is more than a little warm on this planet. Before your brain fries let's set up a way for you to cool down. Provide me with enough power and some water and I can provide you a way to chill water to beat the heat. Don't lose this reward! You only get one shot!

tasks.longDescription: Water on its own cools you by 0.05 degrees, and maxes out at 37 degrees. Cold water cools you by 0.1 degrees and will give you hypothermia if you drink too much of it.

quests.name: Log Entry
quests.description: Things have gone from bad to worse. To call what happened a hull breach would be a gross understatement. I still have no idea what we hit, but there is a 5 meter diameter hole torn through the bridge and then halfway through the ship. All primary controls are literally gone. The ship's computer is offline. Secondary controls and the back up computer in engineering are mostly working, but it doesn't matter. The structural damage means that using the in system drive would tear the Wanderlust to pieces. And she is too close to the planet to use the long jump drive. Communications are out, I've sent an emergency beacon, but that could take months or years before help arrives. I don't have it. The Wanderlust's orbit is decaying and the attitude controls won't respond. In a week, maybe less, she will enter the atmosphere and burn up. I've loaded what survival gear I could onto the shuttle and I will be taking my chances on the planet below. I just hope the shuttle hasn't been damaged.

quests.name: Ramping up
quests.description: We need a stable power source and I believe the reactant dynamo provides a perfect solution. Build a dark place to trap those monsters that roam the night, feed them to a grinder, and pipe the results into the dynamo. Should be good enough to run quite a few machines I think.

tasks.longDescription: 1 grinder will provide enough mob essence and gunpowder for 2 possibly 3 reactant dynamos. Keep an eye on your power and add more if you need to.

quests.name: Tools of the Trade
quests.description: To survive out here, you will need some basic tools, a weapon and some protection from attack.

tasks.longDescription: I suggest making a mattock out of the shovel and axe heads. Also, don't forget you can make hammers out of metal if you have excess ingots.
Knives can be thrown, if necessary. As such, you might want to make multiples, just in case. They are fairly cheap.

Careful! Armor can effect your temperature. Metal armor tends to be hot during the day and cold at night. Leather and wood armor just add a little heat no matter the time. The best armors can help you stay cool in the heat and warm in the cold. Experiment, cautiously.
